p: The successful symbiotic relationship between endophytic bacteria and their hosts could be attributed to hydrolytic enzymes that assist endophytes to permeate plant tissues. Hydrolytic enzymes secreted by endophytes may promote plant growth through hydrolysis of the phytopathogen cell wall [ 48]. Catalase enzymes are the first defense line in microbes that scavenge toxic free radicals formed due to abiotic and biotic stress and, hence, indirectly promote plant growth [ 49].
